title: Blood Drive in Shirley on Friday
title_page: Blood Drive in Shirley on Friday
maintext:
SHIRLEY -- The American Red Cross is encouraging healthy people to donate blood in December, as donations typically decline but the need remains steady.
And residents of Shirley and surrounding towns can do so on Friday, Dec. 22, from 1 to 6 p.m. at St. Anthony’s of Padua Church at 33 Chapel St.
Make an appointment to give blood by downloading the free Red Cross Blood Donor App, visiting redcrossblood.org or calling 1-800-RED CROSS (1-800-733-2767).
All blood types are needed. A blood donor card, driver’s license or two other forms of identification are required at check-in. Donors must be 17 (16 with parental consent where allowed by state law), weigh at least 110 pounds and in good health. High school students and other donors 18 years old and younger have to meet certain height and weight requirements.
